Requirements

Project Background and Client Introduction

Moorfields Eye Hospital is a prestigious NHS hospital located in London. More than 25(not sure) specialised ocularist and admins work in this hospital. Alongside their busy daily schedule where ocularists are seeing patients and making ocular prosthetics, ocularists have to put in a huge amount of time in the process of booking appointments. This is because the current booking system used by moorfields eye hosiptal is not quite efficient.

Data about the patients and appointments are fragmented and stored across seperate excel spread sheets. To elaborate, in the current workflow there is a rota spreadsheet that stored the timetable for a team of ocularists. However, to access the details of the appointments on the timetable, an ocularist would have access an entirely seperate spreadsheet. Alongside this, patient information and waitlists are kept in another spreadsheet. Therefore, in order for ocularists to book in appointments, they have to navigate across multiple spreadsheets and make changes on multiple spreadsheets.

Another major drawback of the current system is that a large amount of information is presented to an ocularist at once, this makes it difficult to find the information that they want, and ocularists find this overwhelming. This process costs extra precious time for ocularists and admins which they could use on work. Moorfields Eye Hospital came to us looking for a streamline and easy-to-operate booking system to save time for their employees.

Client Requirements

We set up weekly meetings with representatives from Moorfields to discuss their requirements and our progresses with the project. During the meetings, Moorfields walked us through the process of triaging a patient. From first recieving their referral, to booking and treating the patient. This helped us design a system and a user interface that our clients are familiar with. They also told us the type of information that needs to be stored on the system which helped with designing the database. After the first few meetings, we refined these main requirements from our client:

1. An easy way to book in and reschedule appointments.

2. An esay way to view patients' information and relative data.

3. Allow multiple people to edit data at once.

4. Multi-platforms, allow ocularists to check their timetable through phone.

We implement filter, search and expanding window functionality so ocularists can see the only information that they want to see.
System will manage database rather than the ocularist, this means triaging patients will no longer be a tedious process.
Implementing synchronisation between the ocularists will lead to less frustration when trying to edit the patients information.

Project Goal

Our goal is to create a web application for Moorfields that frictions with the current system, and reduces the effort needed to manage the workflow. It can be deployed and embedded into NHS standard websites as well as receive data from NHS PAS(The PatientSource Patient Administration System ) system. It provides ocularists and admins simple ways to modify andd read about their daily schedules. We want to create a simple and understandable codebase so that future developers can extend this project.

Use Cases

After understanding our client's requirement, We drew a use case diagram showing possible interactions that users can have with our webapp

MoSCoW List

1.webapp allows multiple viewers to edit appointments at same time with automaticly update after editing and refresh of the data on screen
2.changes should able to record and check changes history of the appointments 3.webapp shows appointments for today only at timetable as a default main page and be able to show appointments for selected date
4.webapp should allow viewers to view specific patients' detail by click patients'name
5.webapp should allow viewers to view and search appointment as well as patients by types and dates
6.Viewers should be able to see and hide team rota
7.Canceled appointments should be automatically removed from rota to reduce repetitive work
8.There should be options to show all free slots
9.webapp should schedule appointment to multiple slots if it duration is longer than 1 regular slot
10.There should be constraints in regards to booking children into slots
11.There should be User authentication for the Ocularists and Admin staff.

1.Use distinct and intuitive colours to indicate different appointment type in my rota.
2.Options to filter information about a patient at waitlist Page
3.Hide patient already seen from time table.
4.Automatically fill in patient details when booking new appointments
5.Arrange free slots between each appointments in a day.
6.Send notifications if appointments due within 2 days are canceled.

1.Suggest patients from waitlists according to their waiting time and urgency. 2.Automatic time slot suggestion when scheduling a patient
1.Manufacturing Tracking
2.Statistics Tracking
